newsitem.title: USA: McLeodUSA readying $175 mln junk bond deal-sources.
newsitem.headline: McLeodUSA readying $175 mln junk bond deal-sources.

text.p: McLeodUSA Inc is rumored to be preparing a $175 million junk bond offering for early this week via Salomon Brothers Inc, according to market sources.
The offering is expected to consist of 10-year bonds, non-callable for five years, that will pay interest in cash.
Calls to McLeod and Salomon Brothers officials were not immediately returned.
The Cedar Rapids, Iowa-based competitive local exchange carrier will not hold a roadshow for the offering in order to tap the market as quickly as possible, sources said.
Sources said the company unveiled the upcoming deal in a conference call with investors on Monday morning.

One trader said spreads on McLeod outstanding 10.5 percent senior discount notes due '07 widened about 20 basis points in morning trading on fears that the new bonds would be priced at relatively cheap levels.
Price talk on the new deal was unavailable.
